page.title: 17BROWNIES: QUINTON
page.content: The movement for young girls, known as Brownies, has had some connection in the village since 1962. The Brownie group used to meet in the Women's Institute room at the top of Friday Street. They moved from there to the village hall, and are now based in the community centre which occupies a pair of army quarters. They meet for about two hours each Thursday evening in school term time. The girls in Brownies are aged between 6 and 11. They wear a brown dress with various badges on. Their activities include bookwork, games and working for badges. There are about 24 girls in the Brownie pack. Brownies are the only national youth group based in the village, apart from the youth club.
